**Title**: Disposal of Expired PPE Supplies
=====================================

**Reference Number**: cb-5872-15968575
**Solicitation Number**: ECSZ-RFP-2023-1973
**Publication Date**: 2023-05-25
**Tender Closing Date and Time**: 2023-06-15T14:00:00
**Region of Opportunity**: Ontario (except NCR)

### Background
As part of its operations, the Office of the Chief Electoral Officer of Canada (External link, opens in a new tab) (Elections Canada) is disposing of a substantial inventory of expired Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Due to inventory control measures taken during the pandemic, a large quantity of PPE was returned unused or partially used, leaving Elections Canada with a significant amount of inventory that must be responsibly disposed of.

### Contract Details
The selected contractor shall provide a comprehensive disposal service for the expired PPE inventory, which includes hazardous waste disposal in an environmentally friendly manner.

- **Contract Date**: [Insert Date]
- **Contract Period**: From [Insert Date] to [Insert Date], with an option to extend for up to two (2) months (the “Initial Term”).
- **Matters Covered**:
  - Pick-up and transportation of expired PPE from various locations across the region
  - Effective and responsible hazardous waste disposal and recycling

### Documents
A comprehensive documentation package, comprising of this notice, bid instructions, and contract specifications, will be provided to eligible bidders through the Government of Canada's electronical tendering and award system: Canadabuys (External link, opens in a new tab).

### About Elections Canada
Elections Canada is seeking qualified contractors that can meet the time-sensitive requirements for the disposal of expired PPE.

### Enquiries
Any enquiries regarding this tender shall be directed to the Contracting Authority, Svetlana Zelyutkina at [Svetlana.Zelyutkina@elections.ca](mailto:Svetlana.Zelyutkina@elections.ca), or by following the instructions in the bid instructions.

### Language of Documents
Documents are to be submitted in one or both official languages of Canada.

### Eligibility
To be considered for this procurement initiative, bidders must have a Supply Arrangement in place with the Government of Canada.

### Evaluation Criteria
The lowest price will be the sole selection criterion, allowing bidders to compete and offer the most competitive price.
